org.apache.cocoon.components.source.impl
Class XModuleSource

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.excalibur.source.impl.AbstractSource
      org.apache.cocoon.components.source.impl.XModuleSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.cocoon.xml.dom.DOMBuilder.Listener, ModifiableSource, Source, XMLizable
public class XModuleSource
extends AbstractSource
implements ModifiableSource, XMLizable, org.apache.cocoon.xml.dom.DOMBuilder.Listener

A ModifiableSource that takes its content from a module.

The URI syntax is "xmodule:[|]:attribute-name[#XPath]", where :

  • an input-module name is used for finding an input-module for reading data from
    • ,
  • an output-module name is used for finding an output-module for writing data to
    • ,
  • "attribute-name" is the name of the attribute found in the module
    • ,
  • "XPath" is an XPath that is aplied on the object in the attribute, by using JXPath.

Version:
$Id: XModuleSource.java 587751 2007-10-24 02:41:36Z vgritsenko $

public XModuleSource(Map objectModel,
                     String uri,
                     ServiceManager manager)
              throws MalformedURLException
Create a xmodule source from a 'xmodule:' uri and a the object model.

The uri is of the form "xmodule:/attribute-type/attribute-name/xpath

public void cancel(OutputStream stream)
            throws IOException
Cancel the data sent to an OutputStream returned by getOutputStream().

After cancel, the stream should no more be used.

getContentHandler

public ContentHandler getContentHandler()
Get a ContentHandler where an XML document can be written using SAX events.

Care should be taken that the returned handler can actually be a XMLConsumer supporting also lexical events such as comments.

Returns:
a handler for SAX events
